comment: A good guy who seems to care about his students. You can come in early to class and he will help you understand the material, but not very good at explaining concepts. There is a ton of weekly homework- anywhere between 9 and 16 sections to complete. Most tests were like the study guide, but some were completely different.

I would say he was ok. He took attendance and used it for a grade at the end of the semester. He has an accent so it can be hard to understand him at times and his handwriting is a little sloppy at times too. When holding lectures DONT be afraid to ask questions bc he may confused you at times. I found myself being my own teacher bc we used Aleks.

He can be a bit rigid. No extra points over here, no matter how many extra assignments we do in class. I found him easy to understand. The Aleks software was difficult to use at times. Sometimes it wouldn't register the answers already entered and I had to redo some topics all over again. Very annoying.

Do not recommend if you don't already fully understand algebra. All homework and tests were completed through Aleks, (an online math program). Personally, I found him hard to understand, and even harder given he wore a mask during lectures. I think there are bonus points for attendance but I'm not 100% sure. Aleks is annoying, so be ready.

Genuinely good professor, clearly cares about sutdents' learning and will pause his lecture to answer any questions so long as you raise your hand. His lectures are very easy to follow, and I personally found no issue with his accent. But if you do have trouble understanding light Indian accents I suggest sitting in the front.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Tests and exams are just like the study guide. He goes over the study guide before every test/exam. If you practice the study guide before each test/exam at least two times, you will definitely pass this class with an A. Great professor and hes very patient!!

Professor Tsegaye gave A LOT of extra credit and all of our work was online. He also dropped the lowest test and quiz grade. The class felt disorganized at times, and he was not the best at responding to emails, but the extra credit and the test/quiz drop definitely made up for it! Attendance was not mandatory and he did NOT use lockdown broswer!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Everything he does is online. He gives extra credit for attendance and will try and help you. The tests are almost exactly like the quizzes(which are take home) so if you show up to class, pay attention, and give an effort youll make an easy B. Youll have to try kinda hard for an A since you gotta work the stuff out multiple times prior for tests
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: His accent is a little difficult, but you get used to it quickly. He is very kind and a very good teacher. He doesn't make you feel stupid for asking questions. His lectures are pretty decent with easy to follow powerpoints. He is VERY patient and will explain things a million different ways. Lots of homework. Flexible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Tsegaye is a great professor for Calculus. I came into calculus with a very basic understanding of mathematics in general, but he provides solid lectures directly from the textbook, and will clarify any proofs/steps if asked. He did a great job in communicating fundamental concepts, to a point where the math become very visual/concrete.

He does about one example for each kind of problem. If you didn't take AP calc in high school this class is going to be very hard. I took AP in high school so I had seen everything we did before, which made it very easy for me. All homework is on web assign and theres a quiz for each test with pretty much the same problems on it as the test.

He's awesome. He only says what you need to know. all homework is online and easy. adds points to all tests. 2 chances to take quizzes ONLINE. quiz exactly like the test. if you show up every day he adds 3 points to your final grade. he's so nice. an awesome teacher.

dude seems like a nice guy but he literally just writes stuff on the board and does not explain what hes doing and why hes doing it. and then he writes at a Mach 300 speed to where you cant even keep up with him or even understand his hieroglyphic handwriting. literally having to teach myself because he cant do his job
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This professor give ample opportunities for students to pass and even make an A. 4 tests the lowest is dropped. Cumulative final. Online quizzes that are the test study guide. His tests are just like the study guide.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I understand that math isn't for everyone but I am telling you that if you go to class and do the online quizzes/study guides before the test it is almost impossible to fail. There are 4 tests, he does drop one, and for each test he gives you the opportunity for 4 extra points. He can be a little draining to listen to some times but he's good.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is a really good professor! He does a lot of examples on the board. 4 tests and a final. Lowest test grade dropped. He gives Pop quizzes that are extra credit added to your test grade. Also if you attend class and miss no more than 2, at the end of the semester hell add 3 extra points on your grade (89 can be a 92)
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He was the worst teacher I have taken for calculus. I took AP Calculus in high school and made an A. He doesn't explain anything he teaches and reads straight off of a powerpoint. He expects you to understand what he is teaching after only saying it once. Be prepared to teach yourself in this class or you will fail. 4 tests. Drops lowest one.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: I couldn't understand a half of what he said throughout the entire course so, beware of a heavy accent. Also, if you take this class, sit in the front because his writing is freaking tiny - pretty much eligible at any other point in the class room. But on the bright side he offers easy extra credit if you show up to the class before tests.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is the nicest guy but the class is pretty boring. All the tests are online so theres not much partial credit.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Gabriel is a great teacher. He provides lots of examples and is always helpful for questions and explains everything in detail. He gives pop quizzes that allow for bonus points on tests, drops the lowest test, and the quizzes for each unit are a study guide for the test. I definitely recommend him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Good luck teaching yourself everything!
